title: Rocky Mountain National Park: Plan A Field Trip
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Education     Plan A Field Trip               Plan A Field Trip        Rocky's education staff provides a classroom without walls. Courtesy NPS   Â    Schedule a Visit  Rocky Mountain National Park offers offers a variety of ways for you and your students to experience the park. We offer two basic educational field experiences - ranger guided field trips and self guided park visits. We also offer classroom programs and web-based distance learning programs. Educational groups coming to Rocky that are organized by an accredited educational institution, whether self guided or ranger guided, may qualify for a waiver of park entrance fees.  Any group wishing to visit one of the park visitor centers must make a reservation through the Education and Outreach Office. If you do not have a reservation, your group may be turned away. Before making a reservation, please review the information for scheduling a self guided or ranger guided visit. Reservations are made on a first come first served basis. We recommend that you call at least three months in advance of your desired date for ranger-led programs. To schedule a program, please call 970-586-3777. Fee Waivers To request a fee waiver for a self guided visit, submit an e-mail, letter, or FAX to:  Fee Program Assistant Rocky Mountain National Park Estes Park, CO 80517  FAX (970) 586-1451  Fee waivers must be requested in writing, on the institution's letterhead at least two weeks prior to the visit. Include a statement about your group's educational objectives.
